definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough

sentences.english: Jame's uncle is an old fox, up to all kinds of evils.
sentences.chinese: 簡的叔叔是個老狐狸，什麼壞事都幹得出來。

sentences.english: When you graduate, look at themselves in the mirror, saw a old fox.
sentences.chinese: 當你畢業時，照照鏡子，看到一隻老狐狸。

sentences.english: Enrico was too good, an old fox, cunning.
sentences.chinese: 恩里科很有心計，是一隻狡猾的老狐狸。
他是詭計多端的老狐狸。

sentences.english: Mr. Ellis, sly old fox, tricked us into buying fake goods.
sentences.chinese: 伊利斯這個狡猾的老狐狸騙我們買了假貨。

sentences.english: An old Fox, crafty and sly, had a den in the rocks, on a hill near her house.
sentences.chinese: 在她家不遠處的小山上住着一隻狡猾的老狐狸。

sentences.english: At last the old Fox thought up a way to catch the little Red Hen.
sentences.chinese: 終於，老狐狸想出了一條抓小紅母雞的妙計。

sentences.english: He knew that once he had caught the sly fox he need not worry about him escaping.
sentences.chinese: 他知道已經收服了的老狐狸不怕他再脫逃。

sentences.english: This businessman is a cunning old fox.
sentences.chinese: 這個商人是個狡猾的老狐狸。

sentences.english: Don't trust him, he is a sly old fox.
sentences.chinese: 別相信他，他像老狐狸一樣奸詐。

sentences.english: Be on your guard! He's a sly old fox.
sentences.chinese: 提高警惕，他是一個狡猾的老狐狸。

sentences.english: I have, '' said the old Fox.
An old fox doeasn't need to be taught tricks.
sentences.chinese: 一隻老狐狸不需要被教授怎麼玩小把戲。

definition: variant of 老奸巨猾[lao3 jian1 ju4 hua2]
rigorous schemes and deep foresight (idiom); astute and circumspect
man with a big smile and evil intentions
(derog.) inept advisor/a good-for-nothing adviser/one who offers bad advice
deceitful in many ways (idiom); wily and mischievous/full of craft and cunning
